div.l: And Nicholas is scalded in his toute
Þis tale is don and god saue al þe route
Here endith the Mylward tale; explicit
The ꝓprolog͗e of the Reues th th tale
Than folk han laughwen at þis nyce cas Caᵐpitulum iijᵐ
Of Absolon and hende Nicholas
Diuerse folk diủersely they seide
But for the more part þei lough ⁊and pleide
Ne at þis tale I saugh no man him greue
But it were oonly Osewold þe Reue
By cause he was of Carpent̉eres craft
A litil Ire is in his herte laft
He gan to grucche ⁊and blamede it a lite
So the yk qduod he ful wel kouthe I yow quite
With bleryng of a prowd melleris eye
Yf that me list to speke of rybaudye
But yk am old me list not pley for age
Gras tyme is don my fodder is forage
This white toppe writeþ myn old yeres
Min̄ herte also mouled as myn heres
But yf I fare as doth an open ers
That ilke fruyt is eủere leng̉ere þe wers
Til it be rotyn in Mullok or in stree
We olde men I drede so fare we
Til we be rotyn kan we nought be ripe
Whe hopen alwey whil þe world wil pipe
For in our͗e wille þ̉er stikeþ eủere a naille
To haue an hoor her ⁊and a grene taille
As hath a leek for þough oure might be gon
Oure wille desireþ folye eủere in on
For whan we may nought don þan wil we speke
Yet in oure asshen olde is fyr yreke
Foure gledes han we which I shal deuyse
Auaunting lying Anger Couetyse
This foure sparkles longoth vnto elde
Oure olde lymes Mow wel been vn welde
But wil ne shal not faylen þat is soth
And yet haue I alwey a coltes toth
As many a yere as it is passed henne
Sen that my tappe of lyf bygan to renne
For sikerly whan I was born an none
